p: Global health research institutions may have holdings or endowments invested in portfolios that include fossil fuel assets. Advocates have successfully called for universities to divest from oil and gas holdings over recent years [26, 27, 28]. Divestment would align endowment portfolios with the health goals of global health research institutions and demonstrate institutional commitments to sustainability. The London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine is among those institutions divesting their assets from fossil fuel investments and reporting on this transparently [29].
